aliens.name: Supreme Overlord
aliens.description: power 5 - You may return a minion to its owner’s hand. FAQ

aliens.name: Scout
aliens.description: power 3 - Special: After this base is scored, you may return this minion to your hand. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

aliens.name: Collector
aliens.description: power 2 - You may return a minion of power 3 or less on this base to its owner’s hand. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

aliens.name: Abduction
aliens.description: Return a minion to its owner’s hand. Play an extra minion. FAQ

aliens.name: Beam Up
aliens.description: Return a minion to its owner’s hand. FAQ

aliens.name: Crop Circles
aliens.description: Choose a base. Return each minion on that base to its owner’s hand. FAQ

aliens.name: Disintegrator
aliens.description: Place a minion of power 3 or less on the bottom of its owner’s deck. FAQ

aliens.name: Invasion
aliens.description: Move a minion to another base. FAQ

aliens.name: Jammed Signal
aliens.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: This base's abilities are cancelled. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

aliens.name: Probe
aliens.description: Look at another player’s hand and choose a minion in it. That player discards that minion. FAQ

aliens.name: Terraforming
aliens.description: Search the base deck for a base. Swap it with a base in play (discard all actions attached to it). All minions from the original base remain. Shuffle the base deck. You may play an extra minion on the new base. (errata'd by The Bigger Geekier Box) FAQ

aliens.name: Terraforming
aliens.description: Search the base deck for a base and swap it with a base in play. You may play an extra minion there. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

ninjas.name: Ninja Master
ninjas.description: power 5 - You may destroy a minion on this base. FAQ

ninjas.name: Tiger Assassin
ninjas.description: power 4 - You may destroy a minion of power 3 or less on this base. FAQ

ninjas.name: Shinobi
ninjas.description: power 3 - Special: Before a base scores, you may play this minion there. You can only use one Shinobi’s ability per base. FAQ

ninjas.name: Ninja Acolyte
ninjas.description: power 2 - Talent: If you have not played a minion on this turn, you may return this minion to your hand and play an extra minion here immediately. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

ninjas.name: Assassination
ninjas.description: Play on a minion. Ongoing: Destroy this minion at the end of the turn. FAQ

ninjas.name: Disguise
ninjas.description: Choose one or two of your minions on one base. Play an equal number of extra minions there, and return the chosen minions to your hand. FAQ

ninjas.name: Hidden Ninja
ninjas.description: Special: Before a base scores, play a minion there. FAQ

ninjas.name: Infiltrate
ninjas.description: Play on a base. You may destroy another action on this base. Talent: Destroy this action to cancel this base's ability until the start of your turn. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

ninjas.name: Poison
ninjas.description: Play on a minion. Destroy any number of actions on it. Ongoing: This minion has -4 power. (Minions have minimum power of 0.) FAQ

ninjas.name: Seeing Stars
ninjas.description: Destroy a minion of power 3 or less. FAQ

ninjas.name: Smoke Bomb
ninjas.description: Play on one of your minions. Ongoing: This minion is not affected by other players' actions. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

ninjas.name: Way of Deception
ninjas.description: Move one of your minions to another base. FAQ

pirates.name: Pirate King
pirates.description: power 5 - Special: Before a base scores, you may move this minion there. FAQ

pirates.name: Buccaneer
pirates.description: power 4 - Ongoing: Once per turn, if this minion would be destroyed, you may move it to another base instead. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

pirates.name: Cut Lass
pirates.description: power 3 - You may destroy a minion here of power 2 or less. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

pirates.name: First Mate
pirates.description: power 2 - Special: After this base is scored, you may move this minion to another base instead of the discard pile. FAQ

pirates.name: Broadside
pirates.description: Destroy all of one player’s minions of power 2 or less on a base where you have a minion. FAQ

pirates.name: Cannon
pirates.description: Destroy up to two minions of power 2 or less. FAQ

pirates.name: Dinghy
pirates.description: Move up to two of your minions to other bases. FAQ

pirates.name: Full Sail
pirates.description: Move any number of your minions to other bases. Special: Before a base scores, you may play this card. FAQ

pirates.name: Powderkeg
pirates.description: Destroy one of your minions and all minions with equal or less power on the same base. FAQ

pirates.name: Sea Dogs
pirates.description: Name a faction. Move all other players’ minions of that faction from one base to another. FAQ

pirates.name: Shanghai
pirates.description: Move another player’s minion to another base. FAQ

pirates.name: Swashbuckling
pirates.description: Each of your minions gains +1 power until the end of the turn. FAQ

robots.name: Nukebot
robots.description: power 5 - Ongoing: After this minion is destroyed, destroy each other player’s minions on this base. FAQ

robots.name: Warbot
robots.description: power 4 - Ongoing: This minion cannot be destroyed. FAQ

robots.name: Hoverbot
robots.description: power 3 - Reveal the top card of your deck. If it is a minion, you may play it as an extra minion. Otherwise, return it to the top of your deck. FAQ

robots.name: Zapbot
robots.description: power 2 - You may play an extra minion of power 2 or less. FAQ

robots.name: Microbot Alpha
robots.description: power 1 - Ongoing: Gains +1 power for each of your other Microbots. All of your minions are considered Microbots. FAQ

robots.name: Microbot Archive
robots.description: power 1 - Ongoing: After one of your Microbots (including this one) is destroyed, draw a card. FAQ

robots.name: Microbot Fixer
robots.description: power 1 - If this is the first minion you played this turn, you may play an extra minion. Ongoing: Each of your Microbots gains +1 power. FAQ

robots.name: Microbot Guard
robots.description: power 1 - Destroy a minion on this base with power less than the number of minions you have here. FAQ

robots.name: Microbot Reclaimer
robots.description: power 1 - If this is the first minion you played this turn, you may play an extra minion. Shuffle any number of Microbots from your discard pile into your deck. FAQ

robots.name: Tech Center
robots.description: Choose a base. Draw one card for each of your minions there. FAQ

tricksters.name: Leprechaun
tricksters.description: power 5 - Ongoing: After another player plays a minion here with less power than this minion’s power, destroy it (resolve its ability first). FAQ

tricksters.name: Brownie
tricksters.description: power 4 - Ongoing: After another player plays a card that affects this minion, that player discards two random cards. FAQ

tricksters.name: Gnome
tricksters.description: power 3 - You may destroy a minion on this base with power less than the number of minions you have here. FAQ

tricksters.name: Gremlin
tricksters.description: power 2 - Ongoing: After this minion is destroyed, draw a card and each other player discards a random card. FAQ

tricksters.name: Block the Path
tricksters.description: Play on a base and name a faction. Ongoing: Minions of that faction cannot be played here. FAQ

tricksters.name: Disenchant
tricksters.description: Destroy an action that has been played on a minion or base. FAQ

tricksters.name: Enshrouding Mist
tricksters.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: On your turn, you may play an extra minion here. FAQ

tricksters.name: Flame Trap
tricksters.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: After another player plays a minion here, destroy it (resolve its ability first) and this card. FAQ

tricksters.name: Hideout
tricksters.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: If another player’s action would affect your minions here, destroy this card and the action does not affect your minions. FAQ

tricksters.name: Mark of Sleep
tricksters.description: Choose a player. That player cannot play actions on his or her next turn. FAQ

tricksters.name: Pay the Piper
tricksters.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: After another player plays a minion here, that player discards a card. FAQ

tricksters.name: Take the Shinies
tricksters.description: Each other player discards two random cards. FAQ

wizards.name: Archmage
wizards.description: power 4 - Talent: Play an extra action. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

wizards.name: Chronomage
wizards.description: power 3 - You may play an extra action this turn. FAQ

wizards.name: Neophyte
wizards.description: power 2 - Reveal the top card of your deck. If it is an action, you may place it in your hand or play it as an extra action. Otherwise, return it to the top of your deck. FAQ

wizards.name: Mass Enchantment
wizards.description: Reveal the top card of each other player’s deck. Play one revealed action as an extra action. Return unused cards to the top of their decks. FAQ

wizards.name: Portal
wizards.description: Reveal the top five cards of your deck. Place any number of minions revealed into your hand. Return the other cards to the top of your deck in any order. FAQ

wizards.name: Sacrifice
wizards.description: Choose one of your minions. Draw cards equal to its power. Destroy that minion. FAQ

wizards.name: Scry
wizards.description: Search your deck for an action and reveal it to all players. Place it into your hand and shuffle your deck. FAQ

wizards.name: Winds of Change
wizards.description: Shuffle your hand into your deck and draw five cards. You may play an extra action. FAQ

zombies.name: Zombie Lord
zombies.description: power 5 - You may play an extra minion of power 2 or less from your discard pile on each base where you have no minions. FAQ

zombies.name: Grave Digger
zombies.description: power 4 - You may place a minion from your discard pile into your hand. FAQ

zombies.name: Tenacious Z
zombies.description: power 2 - Special: On your turn you may play this card from your discard pile as an extra minion. You may only use the ability of one Tenacious Z each turn. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

zombies.name: Walker
zombies.description: power 2 - Look at the top card of your deck. Discard it or return it to the top of your deck. FAQ

zombies.name: Grave Robbing
zombies.description: Place a card from your discard pile into your hand. FAQ

zombies.name: Lend a Hand
zombies.description: Shuffle any number of cards from your discard pile into your deck. FAQ

zombies.name: Mall Crawl
zombies.description: Search your deck for any number of cards with the same name and place them into your discard pile. Shuffle your deck. FAQ

zombies.name: Not Enough Bullets
zombies.description: Place any number of minions with the same name from your discard pile into your hand. FAQ

zombies.name: Outbreak
zombies.description: Play an extra minion on a base where you have no minions. FAQ

zombies.name: Overrun
zombies.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: Other players cannot play minions on this base. Destroy this action at the start of your turn. FAQ

zombies.name: They Keep Coming
zombies.description: Play an extra minion from your discard pile. FAQ

zombies.name: They’re Coming To Get You
zombies.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: Once on your turn, you may play a minion here from your discard pile instead of from your hand. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

dinosaurs.name: Laseratops
dinosaurs.description: power 4 - You may destroy a minion here of printed power 2 or less. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

dinosaurs.name: Armor Stego
dinosaurs.description: power 3 - Talent: Until the start of your turn, this minion has +2 power during other players' turns. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

dinosaurs.name: War Raptor
dinosaurs.description: power 2 - Ongoing: Gains +1 power for each War Raptor on this base (including this one). FAQ

dinosaurs.name: Augmentation
dinosaurs.description: One minion gains +4 power until the end of your turn. FAQ

dinosaurs.name: Howl
dinosaurs.description: Each of your minions gains +1 power until the end of your turn. FAQ

dinosaurs.name: Natural Selection
dinosaurs.description: Choose one of your minions on a base. Destroy a minion there with less power than yours. FAQ

dinosaurs.name: Rampage
dinosaurs.description: Reduce the breakpoint of a base by the power of one of your minions on that base until the end of the turn. FAQ

dinosaurs.name: Survival of the Fittest
dinosaurs.description: Destroy the lowest-power minion (you choose in case of a tie) on each base with a higher-power minion. FAQ

dinosaurs.name: Tooth and Claw... and Guns
dinosaurs.description: Play on a minion. Ongoing: This minion is not affected by other players' cards. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

dinosaurs.name: Upgrade
dinosaurs.description: Play on a minion. Ongoing: This minion has +2 power. FAQ

dinosaurs.name: Wildlife Preserve
dinosaurs.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: Your minions here are not affected by other players’ actions. FAQ

bear_cavalry.name: General Ivan
bear_cavalry.description: power 6 - Ongoing: Your minions cannot be destroyed. FAQ

bear_cavalry.name: Polar Commando
bear_cavalry.description: power 4 - Ongoing: If this is your only minion on this base, it has +2 power and cannot be destroyed. FAQ

bear_cavalry.name: Bear Cavalry
bear_cavalry.description: power 3 - Move another player’s minion from here to another base. FAQ

bear_cavalry.name: Cub Scout
bear_cavalry.description: power 3 - Ongoing: After another player’s minion moves here, if it has less power than this minion, destroy it. FAQ

bear_cavalry.name: Bear Hug
bear_cavalry.description: Each other player destroys his or her minion with the least power (owner controller chooses in case of ties). (errata'd by The Bigger Geekier Box) FAQ

bear_cavalry.name: Bear Necessities
bear_cavalry.description: Destroy an action that has been played on a minion or base. FAQ

bear_cavalry.name: Bear Rides You
bear_cavalry.description: Move one of your minions to another base. FAQ

bear_cavalry.name: Commission
bear_cavalry.description: Play an extra minion. Then move another player’s minion from the extra minion’s base to another base. FAQ

bear_cavalry.name: High Ground
bear_cavalry.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: If you have a minion here, destroy any other player’s minion that moves here. FAQ

bear_cavalry.name: Superiority
bear_cavalry.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: Your minions here cannot be destroyed, moved, or returned to your hand or deck by other players’ cards. FAQ

bear_cavalry.name: You’re Pretty Much Borscht
bear_cavalry.description: Choose a base where you have a minion. Move all other players’ minions from there to one other base. FAQ

bear_cavalry.name: You’re Screwed
bear_cavalry.description: Choose a base where you have a minion. Move another player’s minion from there to another base. FAQ

ghosts.name: Spectre
ghosts.description: power 5 - Special: If you have 2 or fewer cards in your hand, any time you can play a minion, you can play this card from your discard pile instead. FAQ

ghosts.name: Haunting
ghosts.description: power 3 - Ongoing: If you have two or fewer cards in your hand, this minion has +3 power and is not affected by other players’ cards. FAQ

ghosts.name: Spirit
ghosts.description: power 3 - Choose a minion. You may discard cards equal to its power to destroy it. FAQ

ghosts.name: Ghost
ghosts.description: power 2 - You may discard a card from your hand. FAQ

ghosts.name: Across the Divide
ghosts.description: Choose a card name. Place any number of minions with that name from your discard pile into your hand. FAQ

ghosts.name: Door to the Beyond
ghosts.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: If you have two or fewer cards in your hand, each of your minions here has +2 power. FAQ

ghosts.name: Ghostly Arrival
ghosts.description: You may play an extra minion and/or an extra action. FAQ

ghosts.name: Incorporeal
ghosts.description: Play on one of your minions. Ongoing: This minion is not affected by other players’ cards. FAQ

ghosts.name: Make Contact
ghosts.description: Play on a minion. If you have any cards in your hand, destroy this action. Otherwise, take control of this minion. Ongoing: After this action leaves play, give control of this minion to its owner. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

ghosts.name: Séance
ghosts.description: If you have 2 or fewer cards in your hand, draw until you have 5 cards. FAQ

ghosts.name: Shady Deal
ghosts.description: If you have two or fewer cards in your hand, gain 1 VP. FAQ

ghosts.name: The Dead Rise
ghosts.description: Discard any number of cards. Play an extra minion from your discard pile with power less than the number of cards you discarded. FAQ

killer_plants.name: Venus Man Trap
killer_plants.description: power 5 - Talent: Search your deck for a minion of power 2 or less and play it here as an extra minion. Shuffle your deck. FAQ

killer_plants.name: Weed Eater
killer_plants.description: power 3 - Ongoing: At the start of your turn, this minion gains +2 power until the start of your next turn. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

killer_plants.name: Water Lily
killer_plants.description: power 3 - Ongoing: Draw a card at the start of each of your turns. Only use one Water Lily’s ability each turn. FAQ

killer_plants.name: Sprout
killer_plants.description: power 2 - Ongoing: Destroy this card at the start of your turn. You may search your deck for a minion of power 3 or less, play it here as an extra minion, and shuffle your deck. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

killer_plants.name: Blossom
killer_plants.description: Play up to three extra minions that all have the same name. FAQ

killer_plants.name: Budding
killer_plants.description: Choose a minion in play. Search your deck for a copy of that card and place it into your hand. Shuffle your deck. FAQ

killer_plants.name: Choking Vines
killer_plants.description: Play on a minion. Ongoing: At the start of your turn, destroy this minion. FAQ

killer_plants.name: Deep Roots
killer_plants.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: Your minions here cannot be moved or returned to your hand by other players' abilities. FAQ

killer_plants.name: Entangled
killer_plants.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: Minions may not be moved or returned to hands from any base where you have a minion. Destroy this card at the start of your turn. FAQ

killer_plants.name: Overgrowth
killer_plants.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: At the start of your turn, reduce the starting breakpoint of this base to 0 until the end of the turn. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

killer_plants.name: Sleep Spores
killer_plants.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: Other players’ minions have -1 power here (minimum power 0). FAQ

steampunks.name: Steam Queen
steampunks.description: power 5 - Ongoing: Your actions are not affected by other players’ cards. FAQ

steampunks.name: Mechanic
steampunks.description: power 4 - Choose an action in your discard pile that can be played on a base and play it as an extra action. FAQ

steampunks.name: Steam Man
steampunks.description: power 3 - Ongoing: Has +1 power if this base has one of your actions played on it. FAQ

steampunks.name: Captain Ahab
steampunks.description: power 2 - Talent: Move this minion to a base that has one of your actions played on it. FAQ

steampunks.name: Aggromotive
steampunks.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: If you have a minion here, you have +5 power here. FAQ

steampunks.name: Change of Venue
steampunks.description: Place one of your actions that is on a base or minion into your hand. Play it again as an extra action. FAQ

steampunks.name: Difference Engine
steampunks.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: If you have a minion here, draw an extra card at the end of your turn. FAQ

steampunks.name: Escape Hatch
steampunks.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: If your minions here would be destroyed, return them to your hand instead. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

steampunks.name: Ornate Dome
steampunks.description: Play on a base. Destroy all other players' actions on this base. Ongoing: Other players cannot play actions on this base. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

steampunks.name: Rotary Slug Thrower
steampunks.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: Your minions here each have +2 power. FAQ

steampunks.name: Scrap Diving
steampunks.description: Place an action from your discard pile into your hand. FAQ

steampunks.name: Zeppelin
steampunks.description: Play on a base. Talent: Move one of your minions from another base to here, or from here to another base. FAQ

elder_things.name: Elder Thing
elder_things.description: power 10 - Destroy two of your other minions or place this minion on the bottom of your deck. Ongoing: This minion is not affected by opponents’ cards. (errata'd by The Bigger Geekier Box) FAQ

elder_things.name: Shoggoth
elder_things.description: power 6 - You can only play this minion on a base where you have at least 6 power. Each other player may draw a Madness card. Destroy a minion here belonging to each player who does not do so. FAQ

elder_things.name: Mi-go
elder_things.description: power 3 - Each other player may draw a Madness card. For each other player that does not, you may draw a card. FAQ

elder_things.name: Byakhee
elder_things.description: power 2 - Each other player with a minion at this base draws a Madness card. FAQ

elder_things.name: Begin the Summoning
elder_things.description: Place a minion from your discard pile on top of your deck. You may play an extra action this turn. FAQ

elder_things.name: Dunwich Horror
elder_things.description: Play on a minion. Ongoing: This minion gains 5 power. Destroy this minion at the end of the turn. (errata'd by The Bigger Geekier Box) FAQ

elder_things.name: Insanity
elder_things.description: Each other player draws two Madness cards. FAQ

elder_things.name: Power of Madness
elder_things.description: All other players reveal their hands, discard all Madness cards and then shuffles their discard pile into their deck. FAQ

elder_things.name: Spreading Horror
elder_things.description: Each other player discards cards at random until that player discards a non-Madness card. FAQ

elder_things.name: The Price of Power
elder_things.description: Special: Before a base scores, all other players with minions there reveal their hand. One of your minions there has +2 power for each Madness card revealed. FAQ

elder_things.name: Touch of Madness
elder_things.description: Each other player draws a Madness card. Draw a card and play an extra action this turn. FAQ

elder_things.name: Unfathomable Goals
elder_things.description: All other players reveal his or her hands. Each player who reveals a Madness card must destroy one of their minions. FAQ

innsmouth.name: The Locals
innsmouth.description: power 2 - Reveal the top three cards of your deck. Place any The Locals revealed into your hand. Put the rest of the cards on the bottom of your deck. FAQ

innsmouth.name: In Plain Sight
innsmouth.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: Your minions here of printed power 2 or less are not affected by opponents' cards. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

innsmouth.name: Mysteries of the Deep
innsmouth.description: If you have three or more minions with the same name on a base, draw 3 cards, then you may draw 2 additional cards and 2 Madness cards. FAQ

innsmouth.name: New Acolytes
innsmouth.description: All players shuffle all minions in their discard piles into their decks. FAQ

innsmouth.name: Recruitment
innsmouth.description: Draw up to three Madness cards. For each one drawn, you may play an extra minion this turn. FAQ

innsmouth.name: Return to the Sea
innsmouth.description: Special: After a base scores, return any number of your minions with the same name on that base to your hand. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

innsmouth.name: Sacred Circle
innsmouth.description: Play on a base. Talent: You may play an extra minion here with the same name as another minion here. FAQ

innsmouth.name: Spreading the Word
innsmouth.description: Choose a minion in play. Play up to two extra minions with the same name as that minion. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

innsmouth.name: The Deep Ones
innsmouth.description: Each of your minions of power 2 or less get +1 power until the end of the turn. FAQ

cthulhu.name: Star-Spawn of Cthulhu
cthulhu.description: power 5 - Talent: Place a Madness card from your hand into another player’s hand. FAQ

cthulhu.name: Cthulhu’s Chosen
cthulhu.description: power 3 - Special: Before a base scores, you may draw a Madness card to give this minion +2 power until the end of the turn. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

cthulhu.name: Servitor of Cthulhu
cthulhu.description: power 2 - Talent: Destroy this minion and place an action card from your discard pile on top of your deck. FAQ

cthulhu.name: Altar to Cthulhu
cthulhu.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: Once per turn, after you play a minion here, you may play an extra action. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

cthulhu.name: Complete the Ritual
cthulhu.description: Play on a base where you have a minion. Ongoing: At the start of your turn, place all cards here on the bottom of their owners' decks and swap this base with the top card of the base deck. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

cthulhu.name: Corruption
cthulhu.description: Draw a Madness card. Destroy a minion. FAQ

cthulhu.name: Cthulhu Fhtagn
cthulhu.description: Reveal cards from the top of your deck until you have revealed two actions. Place them into your hand and put the rest of the cards on the bottom of your deck. FAQ

cthulhu.name: Furthering the Cause
cthulhu.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: At the end of every turn, if another player’s minion here was destroyed, gain 1 VP. FAQ

cthulhu.name: It Begins Again
cthulhu.description: Shuffle any number of actions from your discard pile into your deck. FAQ

cthulhu.name: Madness Unleashed
cthulhu.description: Discard any number of Madness cards. For each one discarded, you may draw a card and play an extra action this turn. FAQ

cthulhu.name: Recruit by Force
cthulhu.description: Place any number of minions of power 3 or less from your discard pile on top of your deck. FAQ

cthulhu.name: The Seal is Broken
cthulhu.description: Draw a Madness card. Gain 1 VP. FAQ

cthulhu.name: Whispers in Darkness
cthulhu.description: Draw a Madness card. You may play two extra actions this turn. FAQ

miskatonic.name: Professor
miskatonic.description: power 5 - Talent: Discard a Madness card. If you do, you may play an extra action and/or an extra minion. FAQ

miskatonic.name: Librarian
miskatonic.description: power 4 - Talent: Discard a Madness card. If you do, draw a card. FAQ

miskatonic.name: Psychologist
miskatonic.description: power 3 - You may return a Madness card from your hand or discard pile to the Madness deck. FAQ

miskatonic.name: Researcher
miskatonic.description: power 2 - You may draw a Madness card. FAQ

miskatonic.name: “Old Man Jenkins!?”
miskatonic.description: Special: Before a base scores, destroy a minion with the highest power there. FAQ

miskatonic.name: ... It Just Might Work
miskatonic.description: Discard a Madness card to give each of your minions +1 power until the end of the turn. FAQ

miskatonic.name: Field Trip
miskatonic.description: Place any number of cards from your hand on the bottom of your deck and draw a card for each card you place there. FAQ

miskatonic.name: Gate to Beyond
miskatonic.description: Play on a base. Talent: Draw a Madness card. You may play an extra minion here. FAQ

miskatonic.name: Jinkies!
miskatonic.description: Return up to 2 Madness cards from your hand or discard pile to the Madness deck. FAQ

miskatonic.name: That’s So Crazy...
miskatonic.description: Draw a Madness card. Each of your minions has +1 power until the end of the turn. You may play an extra action this turn. FAQ

miskatonic.name: Things Best Not Known
miskatonic.description: Special: Before a base scores, choose a minion there. Draw up to 3 Madness cards. That minion gets +2 power for each Madness card you draw. FAQ

miskatonic.name: Those Meddling Kids
miskatonic.description: Destroy any number of actions played on one base. FAQ

giant-ants.name: Killer Queen
giant-ants.description: power 4 - Talent: If you played another minion here this turn, place a +1 power counter on this minion and that minion. FAQ

giant-ants.name: Drone
giant-ants.description: power 3 - Place a +1 power counter on this minion. Ongoing: Before one of your minions is destroyed, you may remove a +1 power counter from this minion to prevent the destruction. FAQ

giant-ants.name: Soldier
giant-ants.description: power 1 - Place two +1 power counters on this minion. Talent: Transfer a +1 power counter from this minion to another minion. FAQ

giant-ants.name: Worker
giant-ants.description: power 0 - Place two +1 power counters on this minion. FAQ

giant-ants.name: A Kind of Magic
giant-ants.description: Transfer any or all of your +1 power counters among your minions. FAQ

giant-ants.name: Gimme the Prize
giant-ants.description: Place a +1 power counter on up to 3 of your minions. FAQ

giant-ants.name: Headlong
giant-ants.description: Move one of your minions to another base. Place two +1 power counters on that minion. FAQ

giant-ants.name: The Show Must Go On
giant-ants.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: Your minions here with +1 power counters are not affected by other players’ cards. FAQ

giant-ants.name: Under Pressure
giant-ants.description: Special: Before a base scores, you may transfer any number of +1 power counters from one of your minions to another. FAQ

giant-ants.name: We Are the Champions
giant-ants.description: Special: After this a base scores, transfer any or all +1 power counters from one of your minions here there to another minion. (errata'd by The Bigger Geekier Box) FAQ

giant-ants.name: We Will Rock You
giant-ants.description: Each of your minions gains +1 power for each +1 power counter on it until the end of the turn. FAQ

giant-ants.name: Who Wants to Live Forever?
giant-ants.description: Remove any number of +1 power counters from your minions. Draw a card for each counter removed. FAQ

vampires.name: The Count
vampires.description: power 5 - Ongoing: After another player’s minion is destroyed, place a +1 power counter on this minion. FAQ

vampires.name: Nightstalker
vampires.description: power 4 - Destroy a minion of power 2 or less here to place a +1 power counter on this minion. FAQ

vampires.name: Heavy Drinker
vampires.description: power 3 - You may destroy one of your minions to place a +1 power counter on this minion. FAQ

vampires.name: Fledgling Vampire
vampires.description: power 2 - After you play this minion, if another player has more power here than you do, place a +1 power counter on this minion. FAQ

vampires.name: Big Gulp
vampires.description: Destroy a minion of power 4 or less. FAQ

vampires.name: Buffet
vampires.description: Special: Play after a base scores. If you were the winner, place a +1 power counter on each of your minions. FAQ

vampires.name: Crack of Dusk
vampires.description: Play a minion of power 2 or less from your discard pile as an extra minion. Place a +1 power counter on it. FAQ

vampires.name: Cull the Weak
vampires.description: Choose your minion. Discard any number of minion cards from your hand. For each minion discarded, place a +1 power counter on that minion. FAQ

vampires.name: Dinner Date
vampires.description: Place a +1 power counter on your minion. Destroy a minion of power 2 or less at that minion’s base. FAQ

vampires.name: Mad Monster Party
vampires.description: Place a +1 power counter on each of your minions that does not have one. FAQ

vampires.name: Opportunist
vampires.description: Play on a minion. Ongoing: After another player’s minion is destroyed, place a +1 power counter on this minion. FAQ

vampires.name: Summon Wolves
vampires.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: At the start of your turn, place a +1 power counter on this card. If you have a minion here, counters on this card add to your power total. FAQ

werewolves.name: Pack Alpha
werewolves.description: power 5 - Special: Before this base scores, each of your minions here gains +1 power until the end of the turn. FAQ

werewolves.name: Loup-Garou
werewolves.description: power 4 - Special: Before this base scores, this minion gains +2 power until the end of the turn. FAQ

werewolves.name: Teenage Wolf
werewolves.description: power 3 - Talent: This minion gains +1 power until the end of the turn. FAQ

werewolves.name: Howler
werewolves.description: power 2 - This minion gains +2 power until the end of the turn. FAQ

werewolves.name: Chew Toy
werewolves.description: Choose one of your minions. Destroy a minion with lower power at your minion’s base. FAQ

werewolves.name: Frenzy
werewolves.description: Each of your minions with power 4 or more gains +1 power until the end of the turn. FAQ

werewolves.name: Full Moon
werewolves.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: Each of your minions here has +1 power. FAQ

werewolves.name: Leader of the Pack
werewolves.description: Play on a minion. Talent: If this minion has the highest power here, you may play an extra action. FAQ

werewolves.name: Let the Dog Out
werewolves.description: Choose one of your minions. Destroy any number of minions at your minion’s base whose total power is less than or equal to your minion’s power. FAQ

werewolves.name: Marking Territory
werewolves.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: At the start of your turn, if you have more total power here than each other player, reduce this base's starting breakpoint to 0 until the end of the turn. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

werewolves.name: Moontouched
werewolves.description: Play on a minion. Talent: If this minion has the highest power here, draw a card. FAQ

werewolves.name: Unstoppable
werewolves.description: Play on a minion. Ongoing: This minion cannot be destroyed. FAQ

frankenstein.name: Herr Doktor
frankenstein.description: power 5 - Talent: Place a +1 power counter on another one of your minions. FAQ

frankenstein.name: The Monster
frankenstein.description: power 4 - Talent: Remove a +1 power counter from this minion to play an extra minion. FAQ

frankenstein.name: Lab Assistant
frankenstein.description: power 3 - Place a +1 power counter on another one of your minions. FAQ

frankenstein.name: Igor
frankenstein.description: power 2 - Ongoing: After this minion is destroyed or discarded, place a +1 power counter on one of your minions. FAQ

frankenstein.name: Angry Mob
frankenstein.description: Choose one of your minions. Place any number of cards from your hand on the bottom of your deck. For each card you placed there, place a +1 power counter on that minion. FAQ

frankenstein.name: Blitzed
frankenstein.description: Remove any number of +1 power counters from your minions. Destroy a minion with power less than or equal to the number of counters you removed. FAQ

frankenstein.name: Body Shop
frankenstein.description: Destroy one of your minions. Place a number of +1 power counters equal to that minion’s power, split any way you choose, on your minions. FAQ

frankenstein.name: German Engineering
frankenstein.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: After you play a minion here, place a +1 power counter on it. FAQ

frankenstein.name: Grave Situation
frankenstein.description: Play on a base. Ongoing: If your minions here would be destroyed, return them to your hand instead. (errata'd by Smash Up POD) FAQ

frankenstein.name: IT’S ALIVE!
frankenstein.description: Play an extra minion. Place a +1 power counter on it. FAQ

frankenstein.name: Jolt
frankenstein.description: Place a +1 power counter on each of your minions. FAQ

frankenstein.name: Überserum
frankenstein.description: Play on a minion. Ongoing: At the start of your turn, place a +1 power counter on this minion. This minion cannot be destroyed. FAQ
